title: WA Notify
description:
WA Notify is the official COVID-19 exposure-notifications software for Washington State and Department of Health (DOH). The app is an instance of the Exposure Notifications Express platform developed by Apple and Google and configured by DOH.

Your voluntary use of WA Notify will help anonymously alert you and fellow users in Washington state who may have been near someone with a positive COVID-19 diagnosis. When you enable WA Notify, you are doing your part to help your community slow the spread of COVID-19.

How WA Notify works:
When devices with WA Notify are in close contact, they exchange random identifiers. When someone tells their app they tested positive for COVID-19, other users who received their random identifiers receive an alert that they may have been exposed to COVID-19. Devices receiving random identifiers date-stamp them and record their signal strength so the app can estimate how close the devices were and for how long. Users within six feet for 15 minutes or more of the COVID-positive person are notified that they may have been exposed to COVID-19.

Apple and Google's Exposure Notifications framework runs in the background, even when the WA Notify app is closed. It will not drain the device battery at a rate that would occur with other apps.

How WA Notify Protects Your Privacy:
Washington State Department of Health takes your privacy and confidentiality very seriously. The Apple and Google framework does not link any personal data or location information with the random identifiers exchanged by devices. DOH does not want or need to know where or who you are for WA Notify to work. When you are close enough to another app user, your device will exchange random identifiers with that user.

State law requires that lab results for all persons who test positive for COVID-19 are sent to Washington state DOH. This is not associated with the app. Public health organizations (DOH or local public health) follow up with those who test positive for COVID-19, based on information provided by testing labs. As a courtesy to all app users, public health organizations will verify positive tests and then provide app users with a verification code. If you choose to share a positive test with the app, you must use that code. This prevents people from falsely reporting. DOH wants app users to feel confident that possible COVID-19 exposures notifications received via the app are legitimate.

If you have the current Apple or Google operating system installed on your device, you may have noticed that Exposure Notifications are now included. You cannot enable this function until you have installed the WA Notify app. Apple and Google will delete the exposure notification service tools from their respective operating systems once the pandemic reaches a point that public health no longer requires the use of this technology.

Thank you for installing WA Notify! Together, we can protect our family, friends, neighbors, and colleagues, and keep Washington state moving forward!

Your voluntary use of WA Notify will help anonymously alert you and fellow users in Washington state who may have been near someone with a positive COVID-19 diagnosis. When you enable WA Notify, you are doing your part to help your community slow the spread of COVID-19.

When devices with WA Notify are in close contact, they exchange random identifiers. When someone tells their app they tested positive for COVID-19, other users who received their random identifiers receive an alert that they may have been exposed to COVID-19. Apple and Google's Exposure Notifications framework runs in the background, even when the WA Notify app is closed. It will not drain the device battery at a rate that would occur with other apps.

summary: The official COVID-19 exposure notifications app for Washington
summaryHTML: The official COVID-19 exposure notifications app for Washington
comments: Great idea, but the execution needs improvement. Bluetooth function must be on all the time to get accurate notification. My bluetooth drains my battery so that's not going to work. Why can't the app communicate within itself to identify if another user has been nearby and has received a positive test? Also, if a person has all the symptoms they should be able to self report. I appreciate the states making an effort but this needs to be on a national level for people who need to travel.

So far so good on this app, though it's a little worrysome that the app doesn't have any explicit permissions granted, nor does it ask for any, yet still seems to be able to access a wide swath of things on the device. This feels like a security concern for the device itself, as without permissions requests, it's impossible for users to determine when something changes in the application which widens its permission scope. That's a concern because it's one of the more common malware vectors.

Requires enabling location tracking. While this app may not track location, to use it you have to give google and all your other apps permission to track your location, and turn on your gps, which enables more tracking and drains the battery. Having bluetooth on means some things can track you, but it is stupid to tie it together so that I have to go for total big brother tracking, when all I want is to help keep people safe with just this app. (This is googles fault, not WA DOH.)

Contact tracing should be great. App installs easily and is "set it and forget it" easy. Unfortunately you have to get a "verification code" in order to notify the system of a positive result (and thus notify those contacts that they've been exposed). The problem is NOBODY knows how to get a verification code to put in the app (I called and spoke with 2 of the largest county health departments, as well as the WA State DOH)! Pretty useless if it can't be used to notify others of an exposure!

Small app space even on older phones, great privacy controls, needs more advertising. The more people use this, THE BETTER IT WILL WORK: As it uses Bluetooth to reach out to other users and notifies you if someone reports they tested positive and were in proximity to you, so you know to test/quarantine. 1. Install the app 2. Test when needed 3. Use the "share" button to let your friends and loved ones know!

Thank you for this app. Notifications will be so important, even though my COVID-19 circle is only my husband and no one else. Basically, we are in hibernation. Necessities are grocery shopping, but use Amazon delivery allot and occasional restaurant take out. Hopefully no exposure there, but you never know. Thank you.

Although this app uses phone location and bluetooth tracking data, the fact that it provides reasonable privacy protections while still providing contact tracing is fantastic. There is no way to get 100% anonymous data, but this is about as close as it can get while still serving the necessary purpose.

Very impressed so far. Well done to the team behind it. Hope you can: 1) iterate quickly 2) open-source the code so that you can enhance consumer trust and the security of your product, and 3) remove the need for a code that constrains your ability to receive voluntarily submitted consumer public health data.

I will be sharing this app to friends and family as I wish to do my part in "flattening the curve." I really hope more people gets this app. I noticed some people commenting that they can't turn on notifications. From what I understand is; if you tested positive, you MUST inform the facility where you tested, that you have this app so that they can generate a "code" that you can enter on the app. I hope everyone picks up on this. 🤞

Well implemented. I hope everybody downloads this and together we can bend the curve and help infectious people quarantine. For those who didn't understand, the reason you need a special code to report that you are positive is to prevent malicious behavior where someone falsely reports covid in order to scare off a bunch of random people they've been around. This tool will be useless if people mistrust its accuracy.

I doubt this app even accesses location. Google rolled the location permission into the permission required to use Bluetooth... Since this system works on Bluetooth, that's why this likely needs location permission. Everyone should run this.... Get the damn virus under control.

I am hesitant to install anything that might compromise my privacy. But I am impressed by care with which this was designed. Every possible step to keep it anonymous and protect your privacy was taken. I will happily participate and do my part to slow the spread. We can do this! The end is in sight.

Thank you very much for releasing this app. Props to the tech nerd development teams as well. This is absolutely how technology in this day and age should be used. If you're outright refusing this application's benefits you are part of the problem so knock it off and save your neighbors and friends life. It's pretty simple.

Easy and efficient app. No added fluff, it is serving one purpose, to help with contact tracing. Let's get this thing under control so we can get back together with our communities in person, rather than online.

Update: It took 4 tries to install it but it is finally working on my phone, if you are having issues I would uninstall and try again. This is not working on my Samsung A20 Android phone. It appears to download but just keeps coming back to the download page when I try to open it.

Won't allow you to turn on Exposure Notifications. I Uninstaller, and reinstalled app. Still won't allow me to turn on exposure notifications. I get an error message "something went wrong. Please try again" any suggestions?

If you read through the license and when you have your system locked to ask when applications want privileges, it matches just location data and storage nothing weird with contact lists or photos or camera control or anything... Right on guys good app...

Thank you for releasing this. I've been waiting! Just like every time I'm helping my employer do a "touch point cleaning", I feel like I'm providing a safety net around me in halting the spread. This app is a blessing, I hope I never get a notification I was exposed!
The app is SUPER easy to find and download! No problems at all. Have not had it long enough to give more deatail though.
Appears to be working great. App itself looks good, easy to understand UI, a way to notify others if you have a positive result. Glad that WA state has this and I hope others use it.

The app is free and easy to use. If WA Notify is used properly, I see how it can help to slow the spread of COVID-19. This is an outstanding collaborative effort across the board. I hope that the idea works and that other states follow.
Any additional tool we can use to help save lives is appreciated. The developers of this app clearly spent a lot of time ensuring that contract tracing can be easy and anonymous if done properly.

I think this is a great idea! Why not? Maybe help save a life or lives! I just got the app. I read one review that says he got ads cuz of this app? If it's true I will uninstall. Otherwise, great app and it can only help wth this virus. 😷😷😷😷
Great app! Needs to have a self-report test option, without a verification code, as I've gotten negative tests before and would like to report them.
It won't turn on. I've deleted it and redownloaded it, but every time I try to turn it on, it says "something went wrong, try again."
Finally! This will help shore up the failures we have in tracking spread. Lightweight app, doesn't take up much space.
I installed it and tried to turn it on as instructed. I get "something went wrong, try again" message with no suggestions for correcting the problem.
As a front end for the Google Apple Exposure Notification system it works well. Set it and forget it.

I have covid. My wife and two girlfriends all tested positive. Made it unnecessary for me to get tested (all have identical symptoms). But I can't share my status without some special code that I don't have? Makes this app completely useless if I can't announce that I have it. Uninstalled.
I appreciate the clarity on how the app will work and am interested to see if enough people download that it can help people know when to get tested and self-quarantine!
The more people who opt in, the better it works. It's Waze for contact tracing. Install right now!
Easy to use tool. It is not a perfect notification tool, but better than nothing and the more people who use it, the better it will get.
Contact tracing will help.us get back to "normal" faster. If you want to save local businesses, get this app ASAP.
Thanks for the creation and release of this. Found it a little difficult to find a link to download it however. Hope it helps, It should.
App works, does not drain battery, decent UI, helps with COVID contact tracing. What else can I ask?
So simple and private. You can thank Google for writing 99% of this app.
Helpful tool to flatten the curve until Vaccines control the spread of COVID-19. Thank-you to the Developers and those involved in getting this to end-users.
Great app. Simple, small, and hopefully will save lives. What more can you ask for?
it wont let me turn on exposure notifications, or share my own? I'm on android 9 so maybe that's the problem. please fix that
No issues and if anyone is concerned over privacy/security you shouldn't have a smartphone.
